graphs_all module¶

graphs_all.all_relays(valid, invalid, unknown, labels)¶

graph the percentage of all relays that either has valid, invalid or not found ROA in a graph with time on the x-axis and coverage percentage on the y-axis

graphs_all.get_data(relays, guards=False)¶

input a list of relay objects and analyze the bandwith of coverage, invalid reason etc for all relays and record the percentage of each spec. The graphing functions visualizes specs calculated here.

Parameters

  • relays – (list) list of relay objects

  • guards – (bool) boolean specify whether to only analyze guard relay

Returns

(dict) spec -> value of spec

graphs_all.get_guards(relays)¶

filter out guard relay from a list of relays

Parameters

relays – (list) list of TOR relay object

Returns

(list) list of TOR relay that has the guard flag

graphs_all.main()¶

uses functions declared above and processed consensus pickles to graph ROA coverage information on relays. To use other graphing function, simple add to the end of main function and put in the matching parameters.

graphs_all.not_covered(relays)¶

input a list of relay objects and find those that are not covered by ROA. Also record how many bandwith and relay are not covered within the same ASN.

Parameters

relays – (list) list of relay objects to be analyzed

Returns

(dict) ASN -> [number of relay not covered in the ASN, bandwidth not covered in ASN]

graphs_all.print_v6_data(num_relays, ipv6_bandwidth, num_relays_w_ipv6, v6_covered, v6_invalid, v6_bw_covered, v6_bw_invalid, v6_mlpl, v6_mlpl_valid)¶

print out IPv6 relay information in text format

graphs_all.roas(good, wrong_as, wrong_as_pl, wrong_pl, labels)¶

graph the invalid reasons either invalid ASN, prefix max length violation or both for ROAs, with percentage of ROA on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.
